text: Hi. I've read that AMP is already included as an option in the settings oif the blog in HubSpot. Is there the same function or checbox for the landingpages? Do you see any problem integrating AMP in a landingpage?
Is there or will there be a way to access the head in HubSpot?
via FTP or any other alternative
Iâ€™d love an .htaccess file too
This is accurate, Marketing Starter doesn't come with access to Design Manager, and as a result template development isn't an available feature
Small request - can you thread these conversations? - This particular topic is interesting and it would be good to use Slack's `follow message` option to show updates to it.

Thanks for clarifying <@U24DCSJBE>!

(I should know this, but since we have you) Can they DL and use templates from the Marketplace?
What's DL?
Hi, anyone know if I can integrate a chat on app mobile
Is there a way to have 2 authors on one blog post?
sorry, DL = Download

Might be good to repost this in <#CBZK16L9L|ftp-feedback> and <#CLJJXGTC0|local-development> <@UGMGP7A72>

Might get some ideas with the groups who live in those channels

You're able to add code to the global or page-level head.

Global Head = In Settings -> Website -> pages
Page Level = In the page, click "Settings" -> "Advanced Settings"

No access to .htaccess at the moment.

What would you love to modify in .htaccess that you can't today? cc <@U5SGFUU80>
HubSpot only has the current ability to have one author per post. You can fake this by creating a custom module and adding an additional authors block if you wanted to do it that way

Likewise, you may be able to implement structured data for indicating the 2nd author. See here for some direction on this: <https://webmasters.stackexchange.com/questions/90187/schema-org-book-with-multiple-authors-using-json-ld>

though you naturally wouldnt use the `Book` schema but an article type or blog type:
<https://schema.org/Article>
<https://schema.org/BlogPosting>

So when using workflows, I added a suppression list to the workflow after it was already runnng. Will this kick out current members in the workflow is they are say, stuck in the middle of a waiting period?
Looks like that did nothing, but when i set that list as a goal, it instantly removed them.

It also looks like when you have a knowledgebase domain set the same as domain with content connected (for example secondary content of website pages) the 404 page becomes the knowledgebase page. Can someone verify if this is correct?
Are you saying when you get a 404 you get your knowledge base search? <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/knowledge-base/how-do-i-set-up-and-customize-my-knowledge-base>
we get the KB template with the standard vast 404
im pretty sure this is due to the fact we are in dev using system domains and the one system domain we are using is tied to the dev site and also the kb domain settings in the backend
I just want to point this out in case anyone is using the KB in conjunction with the CMS to see if they too are seeing this kind of error page or this may be just because of system domain usage
Do you have the right permissions have you customized in service yet?
So its not so much about customizing it, its that is this how its supposed to be? When using the CMS and KB on the same domain, does the KB take over for the 404
It appears that is the way it is. We use a subdomain
ah ok. Thanks <@U7KKA4QQM> for confirming this. Appreciated

Sorry at first I thought you were asking if you had to do a template for it, and it is pretty limited, but it does appear to take over for the 404 and that is a super good catch on your part. :slightly_smiling_face:
Yup a client reported a VAST page and when I saw the Help Center Text i I figured this was the case. Time for a bug report lol
maybe make authors using hubdb so you can have an authors page as well?
